climbs.name: With Love Lie Ancients Nestled Within

content.description: The first 3 bolts are easy the rest is sustained and makes one of the best 10c's in Washington.
content.location: So you have found the east face but there are an overwhelming number of lines and they all are pretty hard to decipher. The snoqualmie rock book does an exceptional job at explaining the climbs. However if you do not have the book, there is a rest area with trees about 30 feet back of the wall, this spot is the best shade for this cliff the climb starts straight above these trees. Another way to find this climb is, you look up and there are tiers of ledges. Two climbs start about 20 feet up on the ledge where a belayer can stand there is a big black block one of the climbs goes up this route is Pillar Under Pale Streaks the other route on this ledge is Nocturnal Pulse of Celestrial Palace a 11d the first route to the left of these is With Love Lie Ancients Nestled Within. Belay from the ground and not the ledge.

content.description: A wiggly crack in mossy rock and you'll encounter more moss along the way. Best part is pulling onto a moss ledge into the corner and then more mossy face climbing to the top. Jug at the top is moss.
content.protection:
gear to 3"

Snoqualmie Rock guidebook says there are bolts but I didn't see them. I think the moss ate them. There is a chain anchor at the top.
content.location: From the base of the East Face, walk down the talus along the edge of the cliff and turn the corner to the left. You'll pass some bolted projects along the way. Start from a bed of moss.

climbs.name: The Pillar Under Pale Streaks
climbs.fa: Leland Winham, James Mallory, and David Wolfe

content.description: 5 bolts on 65 feet. Dirty, wet at the top, bolts are in questionable shape.
content.location: There is a large black ledge at the end of east face. Scramble up some 5.4 terrain to belay on the ledge. First bolt is on block, the rest are on the east face. There are two routes on this ledge this is the further right route, the route to the left is nocturnal Pulse of a Celestrial Place.

content.description: A short but fun climb. Crux involved moving up onto a ledge right before the anchor. Great views of Rainier!
content.location: Requires a scramble up a ledge to a belay area. Walk past the first set of bolts (Enchanting Puller Blind; 5.10c) to the route.

content.description: There are two roofs with two great ledges to rest on.
content.location: This climb should be called orange streak because it goes up the orange streak on the wall. Past Black Systems Solar to the left, there is a pretty low bolt probably 7 feet off the ground.

content.description: One of the best 5.9s in Washington. There are anchors in the middle if you choose to do this as two pitches. If done as one pitch I would alpine sling most the lower bolts then back clean any draw you can reach. The route often will have two draws in 6 feet to Â protect the crux and you can unclip the lower draw as you go up. A 70 meter rope won't be enough to lower from the upper anchors.
content.protection: 17 bolts ( probably 4 alpines) and two anchors
content.location: Walk down from west wall past lizard ledge and follow the wall as it bends. The trail kind of levels off here and traverses below the wall. The first route that is west facing on this lower wall is the right spot. This route has the best belay ledge which can hide you from morning to mid afternoon sun.
